customer_addr:
4650 Henry Wilson Creek Drive
Milton, FL 32583

citations.narrative:
Upon arrival at the site listed in the licensee’s account, the inspector called the phone number listed and the voice mail
stated the licensee was currently away from her home in Virginia on travel status. Upon knocking on the door at the
address listed, the current owner stated the licensee no longer lives at the site address and has not for over an year. No
regulated species are at the FL location. The licensee verified that she was no longer at the site via phone on Jan 13,
2025.
The licensee failed to notify APHIS that there was a formal address move or provide the site location where the current
regulated species is being housed. As such, any undisclosed site has not been inspected and is not approved for
exhibition. The licensee must contact APHIS and provide a current site address where any regulated species are being
housed.
Correct by: Jan 17, 2025

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
Per the voice mail listed on the license, the licensee is in a traveling status for the next several months and has left her
last location of Virginia. The licensee failed to provide an itinerary for travel status and locations to the Deputy
Administrator per this regulation. The licensee verified that she has been in constant travel status the last few months via
phone call Jan 13, 2025.
Failure to provide an itinerary with the required information including complete and accurate information concerning the
whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any location other than the approved site must be received no fewer
than 2 days advance of travel, to allow for APHIS officials to conduct routine unannounced inspections. This needs to be
addressed to comply with the regulations and allow for animal welfare inspections.
Correct by: Jan 15, 2025
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee via cell phone.
n

narrative:
2.1(b)(1) 
   
Requirements and application 
Upon arrival at the site listed in the licensee’s account, the inspector called the phone number listed and the voice mail 
stated the licensee was currently away from her home in Virginia on travel status. Upon knocking on the door at the 
address listed, the current owner stated the licensee no longer lives at the site address and has not for over an year. No 
regulated species are at the FL location. The licensee verified that she was no longer at the site via phone on Jan 13, 
2025.  
 
The licensee failed to notify APHIS that there was a formal address move or provide the site location where the current 
regulated species is being housed. As such, any undisclosed site has not been inspected and is not approved for 
exhibition. The licensee must contact APHIS and provide a current site address where any regulated species are being 
housed.  
Correct by: Jan 17, 2025 
2.126(c)  Repeat
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
Per the voice mail listed on the license, the licensee is in a traveling status for the next several months and has left her 
last location of Virginia. The licensee failed to provide an itinerary for travel status and locations to the Deputy 
Administrator per this regulation. The licensee verified that she has been in constant travel status the last few months via 
phone call Jan 13, 2025. 
 
Failure to provide an itinerary with the required information including complete and accurate information concerning the 
whereabouts of any animal intended for exhibition at any location other than the approved site must be received no fewer 
than 2 days advance of travel, to allow for APHIS officials to conduct routine unannounced inspections. This needs to be 
addressed to comply with the regulations and allow for animal welfare inspections.  
Correct by: Jan 15, 2025 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee via cell phone.
